platform_reports.hackerone:
# Clickjacking Vulnerability in https://example.com

## Vulnerability Type
Attackers can embed the target in invisible iframes and trick users into clicking hidden UI elements

## Severity
MEDIUM

## Affected URL
https://example.com

## CVSS Score
5.5 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

## CWE ID
CWE-451

## OWASP Category
A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration

## Detailed Description
Missing X-Frame-Options header and/or CSP frame-ancestors directive

## Proof of Concept
1. 1. Navigate to the target endpoint: https://example.com
2. 2. Check HTTP headers - X-Frame-Options: MISSING
3. 3. Check CSP header - frame-ancestors: MISSING
4. 4. Create HTML page with iframe embedding the target
5. 5. Load the HTML page in browser
6. 6. Observe iframe loads: SUCCESS (vulnerable)
7. 7. If vulnerable, attacker can overlay hidden elements to hijack clicks

## Business Impact
Account takeover, unauthorized actions, data theft through UI manipulation

## Remediation
- Add X-Frame-Options: DENY or SAMEORIGIN header
- Implement CSP frame-ancestors directive
- Review iframe usage in application

## Timeline
- **Discovery**: 2025-12-01T08:32:00.102529
- **Report**: 2025-12-01T08:32:08.926361

platform_reports.hackerone:
# Missing Content Security Policy in https://example.com

## Vulnerability Type
No protection against XSS and other injection attacks

## Severity
MEDIUM

## Affected URL
https://example.com

## CVSS Score
5.5 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

## CWE ID
CWE-693

## OWASP Category
A05:2021 - Security Misconfiguration

## Detailed Description
No Content Security Policy header implemented

## Proof of Concept
1. 1. Navigate to target endpoint: https://example.com
2. 2. Check HTTP headers for CSP: MISSING
3. 3. If missing, site lacks XSS protection
4. 4. Test script injection in various contexts
5. 5. Vulnerability confirmed: YES

## Business Impact
XSS vulnerabilities, data theft, compliance violations

## Remediation
- Implement comprehensive Content Security Policy
- Start with restrictive policy and whitelist needed sources
- Test policy thoroughly before deployment

## Timeline
- **Discovery**: 2025-12-01T08:32:00.102529
- **Report**: 2025-12-01T08:32:08.926583

platform_reports.hackerone:
# Missing HSTS Header in https://example.com

## Vulnerability Type
Vulnerable to SSL stripping and man-in-the-middle attacks

## Severity
MEDIUM

## Affected URL
https://example.com

## CVSS Score
5.5 - CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N

## CWE ID
CWE-319

## OWASP Category
A02:2021 - Cryptographic Failures

## Detailed Description
No Strict-Transport-Security header configured

## Proof of Concept
1. 1. Test HTTPS availability: YES
2. 2. Check HSTS header: MISSING
3. 3. If missing, vulnerable to SSL stripping attacks
4. 4. Test HTTP connection downgrade
5. 5. Vulnerability confirmed: YES

## Business Impact
Credential theft, session hijacking, data interception

## Remediation
- Add Strict-Transport-Security header
- Set appropriate max-age (minimum 6 months)
- Consider includeSubDomains and preload

## Timeline
- **Discovery**: 2025-12-01T08:32:00.102529
- **Report**: 2025-12-01T08:32:08.926760
